message.content:
We multiply the polynomials out term by term, making sure to combine like terms: \begin{align*}
(-5x^3 - 5x^2 - 7x + 1)(-x^2 - 6x + 1)&=(-5x^3)(-x^2) + (-5x^3)(-6x) + (-5x^3)(1) \\
&\quad+ (-5x^2)(-x^2) + (-5x^2)(-6x) + (-5x^2)(1) \\
&\quad+ (-7x)(-x^2) + (-7x)(-6x) + (-7x)(1) \\
&\quad+ (1)(-x^2) + (1)(-6x) + (1)(1).
\end{align*}For the coefficient of $x^2$ to be nonzero, we see we must have $(-5x^3)(-x^2)$ and $(1)(-x^2)$ as the only terms on the RHS that involve $x^2$. Hence, the coefficient of $x^2$ is $5 \cdot 1 + 1 = \boxed{6}$.
